---

_**Agent (model copilot/claude-sonnet-4.5)**_

Let me analyze the font declarations across the HTML files to see if they're necessary or redundant. Let me look at the exact structure in `index.html` to see how many duplicate font declarations exist: Yes, you're absolutely right! There are **massive redundancies** in the font declarations. I can see:

1. **Multiple duplicate `<link>` tags** loading the same fonts repeatedly (Cabin appears 10+ times, Inter appears 3+ times)
2. These duplicates appear in **every HTML file** (index.html, products.html, 404.html, and all component files)

## The Problems:

1. **Performance**: Each duplicate font link causes the browser to make unnecessary network requests or waste processing time
2. **Page bloat**: Adds unnecessary HTML code size
3. **Maintenance**: Changes require updating multiple identical lines

## The Solution:

You only need **ONE** `<link>` tag per font family. Here's what should remain:

```html
<!-- Cabin font - only once -->
<link
  rel="stylesheet"
  href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Cabin:ital,wght@0,400;0,500;0,600;0,700;1,400;1,500;1,600;1,700&display=swap"
  data-tag="font"
/>

<!-- Inter font - only once -->
<link
  rel="stylesheet"
  href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Inter:wght@100;200;300;400;500;600;700;800;900&display=swap"
  data-tag="font"
/>
```

**Would you like me to clean up all the duplicate font declarations across all your HTML files?** I can reduce them to just one of each font per file, which will improve performance and make the code cleaner.
